description.narrative: Child-friendly Justice System established in line with the Convention on the Rights of the Child and other key international standards to protect the rights of children in contact with the justice system, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection â€“ General, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, a more effective national social protection system provides increased coverage, quality, and equitable access for the most vulnerable and disadvantaged groups

mailing-address.narrative: No. 81 A Tran Quoc Toan Ha Noi Viet Nam

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child-friendly Justice System established in line with the Convention on the Rights of the Child and other key international standards to protect the rights of children in contact with the justice system

description.narrative: The legal framework on justice for children has been improved, law enforcement and judicial institutions have been strengthened and the capacity of justice sector personnel has been strengthened, contributing to better support and protection for children in contact with the law. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of guidelines on the provision of services for children in contact with the justice system have been piloted and are issued by MOJ/MPS/MOLISA

actual.value: 2014:Guidelines for the pilot project on ‘community-based support for juvenile in conflict with the law' have been adopted and are being implemented in Dong Thap and HCMC. The Decree on ‘administrative diversion and education at commune level' is being implemented nationally, with UNICEF support for demo

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms

actual.value: 2016: the launch of the 1st Family and Juvenile Court in HCMC in 2016

title.narrative: Approval of the Law on the Handling of Administrative Violations with specific provisions to protect the rights of boys and girls in contact with the law by the National Assembly

baseline.value: Not approved (2012) (i.e. the current Law needs revision to include specific provisions to promote the rights of boys and girls in contact with the law)

actual.value: 2013:Approved. The Law on the Handling of Administrative Violations was approved by the National Assembly in June 2012. It incorporates specific provisions to protect the rights of boys and girls in contact with the law, including recognition of the principle of the best interest of the child, detention

title.narrative: Submission of amended Penal Code with specific provisions for promotion of the rights of children in conflict with the law, children victims and witnesses by Ministry of Justice to the Government of Viet Nam

baseline.value: Not submitted (2012) (A Penal Code exists but does not include specific provisions for diversionary measures and alternatives to detention for juvenile offenders)

actual.value: 2014:The draft Penal Code is available and shared on the Ministry of Justice website for public comment. The draft law, informed and influenced by UNICEF's technical assistance, contains specific provisions for promotion of the rights of children in contact with the justice system, including diversion, a

title.narrative: Submission of National Project on Establishment of Family/Juvenile Courts to the Judicial Reform Steering Committee in line with Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC) by Supreme People

baseline.value: Not submitted (2012) (i.e. National Project on Establishment of Family/Juvenile Courts has not been developed or submitted)

actual.value: 2014:The Law on People's Court Organization was passed by the National Assembly, creating Viet Nam's first ever specialised children's court. With this new court, children will no longer have to attend adult courts, and their matters will be handled by specialised Judges and Court Officers that apply chi

title.narrative: Submission of the revised Penal Procedure Code with special investigation, prosecution and adjudication procedures that are friendly and gender sensitive to children in contact with the justice system by Supreme People

baseline.value: Not submitted (2012) (i.e. Penal Procedure Code needs to be revised to include special investigation, prosecution and adjudication procedures)

actual.value: 2014:The draft Penal Procedure Code is available and shared on Supreme People's Procuracy website for public comment. The draft law, informed and influenced by UNICEF's technical assistance, contains specific provisions for promotion of the rights of children in contact with the justice system, including
